channel.title: PHP Iframe system?
channel.description:
I am working on a system that works with PHP to produce a iframe it works like this:
http://url.com/page.php?somesite.com OR http://url.com/page.php/somesite.com
currently, i get a blank page, or a 404 error
my code: [code] <?php $url = $_GET['$_SERVER["QUERY_STRING"]==("")'];
echo '<iframe src="$url" width="900" height="900" />'; ?> [/code] can anyone fix this?

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Do you even know what were on about Unid? I just put it in a folder called google.com as an example.

Read full topic

Google

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:6, topic:145301”]Yea you’re right, I just thought I’d test it and it didn’t work.

This does:
[php]

<?php $url = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF']; $remove = array('/','folder','index.php'); $replace = array('','',''); $url = str_replace($remove, $replace, $url); echo ""; ?>

[/php]

http://onlyonerule.pwnds.info/folder/google.com/

NOTE: There is a big dissadvantage when doing it like this, the website address you want to set in the frame has to be the route, you cannot do:

example.com/folder/example.php

This will come out as:

example.comexample.php

I’d think of a soluion but im tired atm.[/quote]

just use mod rewrite if its enabled on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Yea you’re right, I just thought I’d test it and it didn’t work.

This does:
[php]

<?php $url = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF']; $remove = array('/','folder','index.php'); $replace = array('','',''); $url = str_replace($remove, $replace, $url); echo ""; ?>

[/php]

http://onlyonerule.pwnds.info/folder/google.com/

NOTE: There is a big dissadvantage when doing it like this, the website address you want to set in the frame has to be the route, you cannot do:

example.com/folder/example.php

This will come out as:

example.comexample.php

I’d think of a soluion but im tired atm.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:4, topic:145301”][quote author=Bang Train link=topic=199018.msg1774019#msg1774019 date=1190510699]
if u got .htacces theres a way to make it http://url.com/page/somesite.com
[/quote]

Yea, you can set the 404 page to gather the information from the header…

This would be a simple way of doing it…
[php]

<?php $url = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF']; //Insert everything that comes before the url in this variable. $remove = 'folder/'; $replace = ''; $url = ereg_replace($remove, $replace, $url); echo ""; ?>

[/php][/quote]
i hope you realize that that probably won’t work, as “folder/” isnt a valid regex afaik, it’s better to use str_replace if you want it like that

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Bang Train:

if u got .htacces theres a way to make it http://url.com/page/somesite.com

Yea, you can set the 404 page to gather the information from the header…

This would be a simple way of doing it…
[php]

<?php $url = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF']; //Insert everything that comes before the url in this variable. $remove = 'folder/'; $replace = ''; $url = ereg_replace($remove, $replace, $url); echo ""; ?>

[/php]

item.title: PHP Iframe system?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Id advise doing it like this…
http://url.com/page.php?url=somesite.com
[php]

<?php echo ""; ?>

[/php]

But of course you can use your first method…
http://url.com/page.php?somesite.com
[php]

<?php echo ""; ?>

[/php]

Read full topic

item.description:

it works like this:

OR
